step1.sentence: She wakes up early every morning so she can get things done before the rest of the office arrives.

step2.story: Mark had a packed schedule on Monday, with three meetings and a deadline looming. He turned off his phone notifications and focused on his task list, determined to get things done. By noon, he had crossed off everything on the list.

step3.story: The project had been stalling for weeks, and the team was losing momentum. Sara called an early meeting, handed everyone a clear list of responsibilities, and said plainly, 'We need to get things done—no more delays.' The energy in the room shifted immediately. People stopped waiting for perfect conditions and started making decisions. By the end of the day, what had seemed impossible was nearly finished. Sometimes all it takes is someone willing to cut through the noise and act.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 해야 할 일들을 완료 상태로 만들다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 업무나 과제를 효율적으로 처리하고 완수하는 것을 뜻하며, 주로 생산성이나 실행력을 강조할 때 사용한다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'get'은 고대 노르드어 'geta(얻다, 이루다)'에서 유래했으며, 'done'은 'do'의 과거분사로 '완료된' 상태를 나타낸다. 합쳐서 '일을 완료된 상태로 만들다'는 의미가 됐다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순히 일을 한다는 뜻보다 효율적으로 빠르게 처리한다는 뉘앙스가 강하다. 자기 동기부여나 타인을 독려할 때 모두 자연스럽게 쓰인다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Stop overthinking and just get things done.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 너무 많이 생각하지 말고 그냥 일을 처리해.
